content: On September 10, 1993, the Atlanta Braves faced the Philadelphia Phillies in a pivotal game that would help solidify their lead in the National League East. Tom Glavine took the mound and delivered an outstanding performance, pitching a complete game while allowing only one run on four hits. This victory contributed to the Braves' eventual division title that season, as they went on to win the NL pennant and reach the World Series.
